roleset.name: to bring to the floor, literally or metaphorically, by shocking or striking
roleset.note: FLOOR-V NOTES: Frames file for 'floor' based on internet usage examples, expansion via VN. VerbNet entry 31.1. Comparison to 'astound' and 'cover.' (from floor.01-v predicate notes)

role.descr: Instrument or Manner if separate from Arg 0

example.name: transitive, literal
example.text: John floored his opponent with one blow

example.name: passive, metaphorical
example.text: I-1 was floored *-1 by the problem

roleset.name: to cover or furnish with a floor
roleset.note: FLOOR-V NOTES: Frames file for 'floor' based on internet usage examples, expansion via VN. VerbNet entry 31.1. Comparison to 'astound' and 'cover.' (from floor.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Mary floored her new apartment with marble tile.
